artist: Artist: Kara Walker; Publisher: Peter Norton Family Christmas Projects, Pasadena, California
creditline: Gift of Evan M. Maurer in honor of Josie Johnson
description: Pop-up silhouette book; binding: maroon buckram covers
medium: Offset lithographs and laser-cut, pop-up silhouettes, letterpress; bound volume
portfolio: From Norton Family Foundation Christmas Project
provenance: The publisher, given to Maurer; Evan M. Maurer, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 1997
signed: Title and artist name debossed on spine: [Freedom: A Fable/Kara Walker]
text: Kara Walker's cut-paper silhouette images, a technique quite popular in the 19th century for both portraiture and narrative illustrations, are bridges between the slavery folklore of the Antebellum South and the identity and gender issues that today concern modern African American women in particular.
title: Freedom, A Fable: A Curious Interpretation of the Wit of a Negress in Troubled Times
